APP.name: APP
APP.description:
Main application module that contains all necessary classes/objects,
methods and properties for the Calculator application.

APP.name: APP
APP.description:
Creates objects and subobjects by using just a string in dotted notation. 
Example namespace('my.new.namespace'); will create object 'my' that contains subobject 'new', which contains 
subobject 'namespace'.

params.name: nsString
params.description: String describing the namespace of objects separated by a dots.

params.name: newObjectDefinition
params.description:
And object to initialize each of the newly created subobject. If you add a property with all caps 
it will consider it as a constant and therefore use Constants object to create new constant that cannot be changed using Firebug 
or other browser debugging interface.

return.description:
Returns the new object that represents the new namespace of objects and subobjects, defined by the dots in the string
argument.

Constants.name: Constants
Constants.description:
Constants is a contructor so it should be called with new keyword. Each object should have its own Constants object.
Creates object of four functions, set(), isDefined(), list() and get() which enable creation of new immutable constant
that cannot be changed with Firebug or other debugging tool.

return.description: Returns object with functions necessary to define new constant and prevent its change.

Main.name: Main
Main.description: Main calculator class. Contains all necessary Calculator related properties/methods.

Aritmetic.name: Aritmetic
Aritmetic.description:
Arithmetic module. Contains all necessary properties/methods related to aritmetic operations. 
Like, addition, multiplication, division, etc... All aritmetic operations are binary operations, i.e need two
operands to work.

Buttons.name: Buttons
Buttons.description: Buttons class. Contains all necessary properties/methods related to the visible buttons.

classitems.description: Constant function. Returns "constMap" string
classitems.name: CONST_MAP_STR

classitems.description: Constant function. Returns "DOMContentLoaded" string
classitems.name: DOM_CONTENT_LOADED_EVENT_STR

classitems.description: Constant function. Returns application's name as a string value.
classitems.name: APP_NAME

classitems.description: Returns application's configuration in JavaScript object format.
classitems.name: appConfiguration

return.description: Returs the application's version in string format.

classitems.description: Returns application's version as a string value.
classitems.name: getVersion

return.description: Returs the application's version in string format.

classitems.description: arrayContains() is a function that returns true if a given element is present in the given array or false otherwise.
classitems.name: arrayContains

params.name: array
params.description: An array object in which we search for a given element.

params.name: element
params.description: A given element that can be object, number or string.

return.description: True if the element is present in the array or false otherwise.

classitems.description:
getConst() is a shortcut function for accessing a constant value. Example: Let just say APP.Math class has a constant PI with value of 3.14
How would you access it, using getConst() shotcut function? You call APP.getConst('APP.Math.constMap.PI'); So the parameter must be in string format
and must contain the subkey 'constMap'. When using APP.namespace() function the newly created subclass/subobject always contains constMap
subobject with keys for each constant. So if you call APP.namespace('Math', {PI: 3.14}); if you search the DOM tree, Math will already contain
constMap = {PI: "PI"};
classitems.name: getConst

params.name: constName
params.description: path of the contants in a given class or subclass.

return.description: Returns the value of the required contant or string error if something went wrong.

classitems.description: listContants() prints all the contants in a given class. Example: APP.list('APP.Math'); will list all constants like PI: 3.14, E: 2.17 etc...
classitems.name: listContants

params.name: className
params.description: Must be a string of keys separated by dot, like so: 'APP.Math.Trigonometry'

return.description: Returns true if the list of constants was generated or sends error message if the parameter was not in a string format.

classitems.description: Prints the application's internal state.
classitems.name: printData

return.description: Returs object of all necessary variables for printing in console.

classitems.description: Creates new immutable constant.
classitems.name: set

return.description: Returs true if new constant is created or false otherwise.

classitems.description: Creates new immuatble constant.
classitems.name: isDefined

return.description: Returs true if new constant is created or false otherwise.

classitems.description: Returns the value of the required constant.
classitems.name: get

return.description: Returns the value of the required constant.

classitems.description: Lists all constants with their values in array like format. Print the returned object in console.
classitems.name: list

return.description: list of constants with their names in JavaScript object format.

classitems.description:
Creates new immutable constant of the main application object. It is called upon page load, so
all necessary initializations which cannot be called before page load should be called in this function.
classitems.name: init

return.description: Returs the main APP object. Returns Error object if the creation failed somehow.

classitems.description: Parses string value into decimal integer number if possible, and then returns the result.
classitems.name: myParseInt

params.name: param
params.description: string value that should be a number.

return.description: Returns decimal integer representation of given string value.

classitems.description: Parses string value into decimal floating point number if possible, and then returns the result.
classitems.name: myParseFloat

params.name: param
params.description: string value that should be a number.

return.description: Returns decimal floating point representation of given string value.

classitems.description: Constant function. Returns "Invalid input!" string.
classitems.name: INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE

classitems.description: Constant function. Returns "Cannot divide by zero!" string.
classitems.name: CANNOT_DIVIDE_BY_ZERO_MESSAGE

classitems.description: Divide method. Divides "result" operand with the value in the display field. It also checks for division by zero.
classitems.name: divide

classitems.description: Multiply method. Multiplies "result" operand with the value in the display field.
classitems.name: multiply

classitems.description: Add method. Adds "result" operand to the value in the display field.
classitems.name: add

classitems.description: Subtract method. Subtracts the value in the display field from "result" operand.
classitems.name: subtract

classitems.description:
Percent method. It needs both "result" and display field values to be different than 0 to work. 
Therefore an aritmetic operation must be used before you can calculate percents of a given value. 
Example: Press number 555 and then press the plus(+) sign button. "result" operand now has the value of 555
and the application waits for input for the second operand. Insert value of 33 and then press the percent(%) 
button. The application finds there are two available operands so it calculates 33% of 555 which is 183.15 and
sets the display field to this new percent value. If you press the equal(=) sign button, it will sum up 555 + 183.15 
which is 738.15. This same set of tasks applies to all other binary operations so if we used division(/) instead of 
adtion(+) the final result would be 3.030303 or (555 / (33% of 555)) = (555 / 183.15)
classitems.name: percent

classitems.description:
pressNumber method (called upon pressing one of 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8 or 9 buttons) is a method that receives one parameter
in string format from one of these '1', '2', ..., '9'. If eraseData key is true, digits field value is cleared and number param value is 
concatenated to digits field, then eraseData is set to false. If eraseData is set to false then any new number button pressed concatenates
its value to digits display field without clearing digits field previous value.
classitems.name: pressNumber

params.name: number
params.description: value in string format. It may be some of these values '1', '2', ..., '9'

classitems.description:
pressUnaryOperation method (called upon pressing one of square root('sqrt'), reciproc('1/x') or negate('+/-') buttons)
recieves some of these values: 'sqrt', '1/x', '+/-'. It needs only one operand to work
since the operations are unary. It also takes cleares the operations text field from uncessary rubbish text.
classitems.name: pressUnaryOperation

params.name: op
params.description: operation value in string format. It may be some of these values 'sqrt'(square root), '1/x'(reciproc), '+/-'(negate).

classitems.description:
pressBinaryOperation method (called upon pressing plus('+'), minus('-'), division('/'), multiplication('*') or percent('%') buttons) 
recieves one parameter in string format from these values: '+', '-', '/', '*', '%'. It therefore calculates the result and 
displays it in the digits display field according to the given operation type.
classitems.name: pressBinaryOperation

params.name: op
params.description: operation in string format from these values: '+', '-', '/', '*', '%'

classitems.description:
pressComma method (called upon pressing comma(,) button)adds dot to the digits display field. 
It there is already a dot it skips adding new one.
classitems.name: pressComma

classitems.description:
pressUndo method (called upon pressing undo(<-) button) removes one digit from the digits siplay field. 
If the digits display field has only one digit, it is set to zero.
classitems.name: pressUndo

classitems.description:
pressClearEntry method (called upon pressing clear entry(CE) button) clears the digits display field and sets it to zero. 
It doesn't however clear result, operation, memory, operand or operandStr.
classitems.name: pressClearEntry

classitems.description:
pressClear method (called upon pressing (C) button) clears all application state except for the memory property which is 
used to memorize values that last even after we do many calculations.
classitems.name: pressClear

classitems.description:
calculate method takes the value from digits field and sets result to it if result is empty. If result is not empty it takes
the operation value and applies apropriate binary operation on "result" operand and digits display field value. It then empties result
and operation properties.
classitems.name: calculate

classitems.description:
pressMemoryButton method (called upon pressing one of MC (Memory Clear), MR (Memory Recall), MS (Memory Save), M+ (Memory Add) or M- (Memory Subtract) * memory buttons) saves current digits field value into parent.memory property and shows M label in view, when MS button is pressed. 
When MR button is pressed, digits field is filled with value from parent.memory property if available. When M+ or M- buttons are pressed, 
digits field value is added or subtract from the current memory value (if set) and saved to parent.memory property. 
MR button sets digits field value to zero if parent.memory is empty or to parent.memory value if not empty. 
MC sets parent.memory property to empty string and hides M label from view.
classitems.name: pressMemoryButton

params.name: memoryStr
params.description: string value which can be some these MC, MR, MS, M+, M-

classitems.description:
pressEqual method (called upon pressing equal(=) button)call calculate() method to do the calculation on "result" and 
digits display value and resets operand to 0 and operation field value to empty string ''.
classitems.name: pressEqual
